name: Secretariat
excerpt: The brilliantly white neoclassical Secretariat building was founded in 1939.
detail_description: The brilliantly white neoclassical Secretariat building was founded in 1939.

name: Ticket Counter (Zoo & Museums)
excerpt: Main ticket counter for Trivandrum's Zoological Gardens and surrounding museums.
detail_description: Main ticket counter for Trivandrum's Zoological Gardens and surrounding museums.

name: Pazhavangadi Ganapathy Temple
excerpt: A Hindu temple dedicated to Mahaganapati, a form of Ganesh, in Trivandrum's East Fort area.
detail_description: A Hindu temple dedicated to Mahaganapati, a form of Ganesh, in Trivandrum's East Fort area.

name: Shri Chitra Art Gallery
excerpt: Within the grounds of Trivandrum's zoo, this gallery displays paintings by the Rajput, Mughal and Tanjore schools, and portraits by renowned Keralite…
detail_description:
Within the grounds of Trivandrum's zoo, this gallery displays paintings by the Rajput, Mughal and Tanjore schools, and portraits by renowned Keralite artist Ravi Varma (1848–1906) in the European style.
In the gallery's small annexe, near the eastern entrance to the zoo, you can see an opulent royal chariot used by the former maharajas of Travancore.

name: Zoological Gardens
excerpt: Yann Martel famously based the animals in his novel Life of Pi on those he observed in Trivandrum’s Zoological Gardens. Shaded paths meander through…
detail_description: Yann Martel famously based the animals in his novel Life of Pi on those he observed in Trivandrum’s Zoological Gardens. Shaded paths meander through woodland, lakes and native forest, where tigers, macaques, hippos, peacocks, deer, leopards and other creatures gather, though some live in small, not very open enclosures.

name: Shri Padmanabhaswamy Temple
excerpt: Trivandrum’s spiritual heart is this 18th-century temple (closed to non-Hindus) in the Fort area, which fuses Keralan and Dravidian architecture and whose…
detail_description:
Trivandrum’s spiritual heart is this 18th-century temple (closed to non-Hindus) in the Fort area, which fuses Keralan and Dravidian architecture and whose origins go back to at least the 8th century. The main entrance is through the 30m-tall, seven-tier eastern gopuram (gateway tower), in Tamil Nadu style. In the inner sanctum, Padmanabha (a manifestation of Vishnu) reclines on the sacred serpent and is made from over 10,000 saligrams (sacred stones) purportedly transported from Nepal by elephant.
A treasure stash with an estimated value of US$1 trillion was unearthed in a series of previously locked vaults beneath the temple in 2011, making it India's richest temple. The path around to the right of the eastern gate offers good views of the gopuram.

name: St Joseph's Cathedral
excerpt: One of Trivandrum's major churches, the Roman Catholic St Joseph's is a whitewashed neo-Gothic creation from 1873, topped by a soaring bell tower added in…
detail_description: One of Trivandrum's major churches, the Roman Catholic St Joseph's is a whitewashed neo-Gothic creation from 1873, topped by a soaring bell tower added in the 1920s.

name: Natural History Museum
excerpt: In Trivandrum's Zoological Gardens complex (but not inside the zoo itself), the Natural History Museum contains hundreds of stuffed animals and birds and…
detail_description: In Trivandrum's Zoological Gardens complex (but not inside the zoo itself), the Natural History Museum contains hundreds of stuffed animals and birds and a fine skeleton collection. It was closed for renovations at research time.

name: Mateer Memorial Church
excerpt: A graceful landmark church, 450m west of Trivandrum's Zoological Gardens, dating from 1906.
detail_description: A graceful landmark church, 450m west of Trivandrum's Zoological Gardens, dating from 1906.

name: Christ Church
excerpt: Towards the north end of MG Rd stands this fine neo-Gothic Anglican church, notable for its stained glass and 19th-century tombs.
detail_description: Towards the north end of MG Rd stands this fine neo-Gothic Anglican church, notable for its stained glass and 19th-century tombs.

name: Kanakakunnu Palace
excerpt: Built for the royal family of Travancore, this early-20th-century palace is now mostly a venue for cultural events and performances.
detail_description: Built for the royal family of Travancore, this early-20th-century palace is now mostly a venue for cultural events and performances.

name: State Central Library
excerpt: A red-brick neo-Gothic construction, built in 1900 to commemorate the Diamond Jubilee of Queen Victoria.
detail_description: A red-brick neo-Gothic construction, built in 1900 to commemorate the Diamond Jubilee of Queen Victoria.

name: Puthe Maliga Palace Museum
excerpt: Overlooking the Shri Padmanabhaswamy Temple tank, the opulent 18th-century palace of the Travancore maharajas is a classically Keralan world of…
detail_description: Overlooking the Shri Padmanabhaswamy Temple tank, the opulent 18th-century palace of the Travancore maharajas is a classically Keralan world of beautifully carved wooden ceilings, tiled roofs, marble sculptures and imported Belgian glass. Inside you’ll find Kathakali images, an armoury, portraits of maharajas, ornate thrones and other artefacts. Admission is by informative one-hour tour, though you can just visit the outside of the palace grounds (free).

name: Napier Museum
excerpt: Housed in an 1880 wooden building designed by Robert Chisholm (a British architect whose Fair Isle–style version of the Keralite vernacular shows his…
detail_description: Housed in an 1880 wooden building designed by Robert Chisholm (a British architect whose Fair Isle–style version of the Keralite vernacular shows his enthusiasm for local craft), this museum holds an eclectic display of bronzes, Buddhist sculptures, temple carts, ivory carvings and a wood-carved model of Kerala's famous Guruvayur temple. The architectural style fuses neo-Gothic and Keralan elements, and the carnivalesque interior is worth a look in its own right.

name: Museum of History & Heritage
excerpt: Occupying a handsome 120-year-old heritage building within the Kerala Tourism complex, this intelligently presented museum traces Kerala's history and…
detail_description: Occupying a handsome 120-year-old heritage building within the Kerala Tourism complex, this intelligently presented museum traces Kerala's history and culture through superb static and multimedia displays. Exhibits range from Iron Age implements to bronze, wood and terracotta sculptures, murals, dhulichitra (floor paintings), Roman-era coins, re-creations of traditional Keralite homes and replicas of engravings at Wayanad's Edakkal Caves.
